text: Signs and Symptoms Approximate number of patients (when available) Abnormality of the musculature 90% Limitation of joint mobility 90% Short stature 90% Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand 90% Abnormality of the hip bone 7.5% Mandibular prognathia 7.5% Ptosis 7.5% Deep philtrum 5% Macrocephaly 5% Autosomal dominant inheritance - Cutaneous syndactyly of toes - Distal arthrogryposis - Dysphagia - Facial asymmetry - Feeding difficulties - Hammertoe - Hip dislocation - Talipes equinov
